thread.title: Question time is coming to Exeter next week: How to get in the audience

author: Richard Booth
title: Question time is coming to Exeter next week: How to get in the audience
text:
Question Time is coming to Exeter Share Thank you for subscribing!
BBC politics show Question Time is coming to Exeter next week and audience members are wanted for the show.
The show will be at Exeter Northcott Theatre, Streatham Campus, University of Exeter on Thursday 28th.
The Exeter visit follows the show being presented from Birmingham on the 21 – with Exeter resident and Wetherspoons boss Tim Martin appearing on the panel.
It will be the last time David Dimbleby will be hosting the show in Exeter after announcing he will leave at the end of the year – after 25 years.
Producers are now keen for people in the local area to apply to be part of the show in the audience. Read More Government accused of dirty tricks in bid to win vital Brexit deal vote - Devon MPs react
David Dimbleby said: "I am very much looking forward to bringing Question Time to Exeter. What really matters is that we have a lively audience who want to speak their mind. It’s a chance for people in Exeter to get their voice heard not just by politicians, but right across the UK.”
What you need to know
· People from Exeter and the surrounding area can apply to be part of the audience via the website: bbc.co.uk/questiontime or by phone: 0330 123 9988
· Question Time is the nation’s most popular political debate programme, on BBC One, Thursdays, 10:45pm
· There are approximately 100 people in the audience, selected to ensure political balance
· Question Time always has representation from the government of the day and the official opposition party, as well as representatives from other political parties. The rest of the panel is made-up of political commentators and well-known public figures Read More A strong case to legalise cannabis and take crime off the streets
Facts:
· Question Time began on Tuesday 25 September 1979 and David Dimbleby has been presenting the programme since 1994
· This will be Question Time’s sixth visit to Exeter. The last visit was in April 2016, with Liam Fox, Paddy Ashdown, Kate Hoey, Leanne Wood and Tim Martin on the panel. Like us on Facebook
